[1963-08-02T19:50:00] On the way home | I heard, "I can't stand it anymore!"
"Take your time, get up, let's go. Aren't you hungry?"
"Don't tell me to take my time! When you say that, it really gets on my nerves. I can't stand you anymore, Elena, and your 'take your time' nonsense."
[1963-08-02T19:55:00] On the way home | I saw her start to cry, patting her thigh all the while.
[1963-08-02T20:00:00] On the way home | I saw that I realized Lina hadn't waited for us; she had already walked away alone. I thought to myself that she made this decision not because she was annoyed or indifferent, but because of some very intense reason, one that seemed to burn her as much as being near us.
[1963-08-02T20:05:00] On the way home | I saw myself helping Pinocchia stand up and holding her bag.
[1963-08-02T21:00:00] Renting house | I saw that Pinochietta gradually calmed down, but that night she kept a sour face, as if we had done something to hurt her.
[1963-08-02T21:30:00] Renting house | I saw that later she wasn't even polite to Nunzia, saying the noodles were undercooked. Lina sighed and then gave her a furious verbal beating in the local dialect.
[1963-08-02T22:00:00] Renting House | I saw the night when Pinocchia decided to sleep in my room.
[1963-08-02T23:00:00] Renting house | I saw her sleeping restlessly. The two of them were crammed into such a tiny room that they couldn't even catch their breath, and their bodies were drenched with sweat, soaking through their clothes.
[1963-08-03T04:00:00] Rentals | I saw that I later had to open the window, but I was immediately surrounded by mosquitoes. I couldn't sleep at all, so I got up as soon as it was light.
[1963-08-03T05:00:00] Renting House | I saw three or four mosquito bites on my face, and I felt completely unable to show my face in public. I thought my mood was also very bad now.
[1963-08-03T05:10:00] Rentals | I saw myself going to the kitchen, and Nunzia was already washing our clothes.
[1963-08-03T05:15:00] Rentals | I saw that Lina was also up, she had already drunk her milk and was looking at another one of my books. I thought about when she might have taken it.
[1963-08-03T05:20:00] Renting House | I saw her look at me with a scrutinizing gaze as soon as I came in. She made an innocent face and asked me a question that surprised me. I heard, "How is Pinocchio?"  
"I don't know."
[1963-08-03T05:25:00] Renting house | I heard, "You're angry?"  
"Yes, I didn't sleep all night, look at my face."  
"Can't tell."  
"That's because you see nothing at all."
[1963-08-03T05:30:00] Renting House | I heard, "Nino and Bruno will also be invisible."  
"What does that have to do with them?"  
"Do you care about Nino?"  
"I've told you a hundred times, I don't care about him."
[1963-08-03T05:35:00] Rentals | I heard, "Don't get excited."
"I'm calm."
"We have to be careful with Pinocchia."
"You have to be careful with her. She's your sister-in-law, not mine."
"Are you angry?"
"Yes, yes, yes."
[1963-08-03T09:00:00] On the way to the beach | I saw us walking nervously toward the beach. I saw that the day was even hotter than the previous one, and bad mood seemed to spread like an infection, infecting all of us.
[1963-08-03T09:10:00] On the way to the beach | I saw that on the way, Pinocchia realized she had forgotten her towel and had another fit.
[1963-08-03T09:15:00] On the way to the beach | I saw Lina walking forward with her head down, not even looking back. I heard "I'll go get it." I volunteered.  
"No, I want to go home. I don't want to go to the beach anymore."
[1963-08-03T09:20:00] On the way to the beach | I heard, "Do you feel unwell?"  
"I'm fine."  
"Then why?"  
"Look at my stomach."
[1963-08-03T09:25:00] On the way to the beach | I looked at her stomach and, without thinking, said. "I heard, 'What about me? Look at my face, it's been bitten by mosquitoes so badly.'"
[1963-08-03T09:30:00] On the way to the beach | I saw her start shouting at me, saying, "You're a fool!" Then she quickened her pace and caught up with Lina.
[1963-08-03T10:00:00] Beach | I saw that we had reached the beach, and she immediately apologized to me, saying, "You're so honest, so proper," which made me very angry. I heard, "I'm very honest?"  
"I wanted to say you're good."  
"I'm not good at all."
[1963-08-03T10:05:00] Beach | I saw Lina keep staring at the sea in the direction of Mergellina, trying not to be affected by us. Finally, she said coldly. I heard, "Stop fighting, they're coming."
[1963-08-03T10:10:00] Beach | I saw Pinocchia mutter, "Your one has come." Suddenly her voice softened. She applied lipstick to her lips, even though she had already put on plenty.
[1963-08-03T10:15:00] Beach | I thought about the two boys' feelings, which were even worse than ours.
[1963-08-03T10:20:00] Beach | I saw Nino speaking to Lina in a mocking tone. I heard, "Tonight, your husbands are all coming, right?"  
"Of course."  
"What fun things are you going to do?"  
"We'll eat, drink, and then go to sleep."
[1963-08-03T10:25:00] Beach | I heard, "What about tomorrow?"  
"Tomorrow we eat, drink, and then go to sleep."  
"Will they be there on Sunday night?"  
"No, on Sunday we eat, drink, and take a nap in the afternoon."
[1963-08-03T10:30:00] Beach | I saw myself hiding my sarcastic tone and forcing myself to speak. "I heard, 'I'm free. I don't eat or drink, I don't sleep.'"
[1963-08-03T10:35:00] Beach | I saw Nino looking at me as if he had just noticed a problem he'd never seen before. He touched my right cheekbone with one hand—I had been bitten by a mosquito there, and it was swollen more noticeably than the rest.
[1963-08-03T10:40:00] Beach | I saw him speaking to me very seriously. I heard, "Okay, we'll meet here tomorrow morning at seven o'clock, then we'll go hiking. After that, we'll stay by the sea until late. What do you think?"
[1963-08-03T10:45:00] Beach | I felt a wave of joy surging through my veins, and I said quite naturally. I heard, "Okay, seven o'clock in the morning, I'll bring something to eat."
[1963-08-03T10:50:00] Beach | I saw Pinocchio looking somewhat disappointed and asked. "I heard, 'What about us?'"
[1963-08-03T10:55:00] Beach | I saw him mutter something, and when he said the word "husband," it was as if he were speaking of a toad, a venomous snake, or a spider. I heard, "You have husbands."
[1963-08-03T11:00:00] Beach | I saw Pinocchio stand up suddenly after hearing those words and start walking toward the seashore.
[1963-08-03T11:05:00] Beach | I saw myself making an excuse for her. I heard, "She's been a bit too sensitive lately. It's because of her [childbearing condition], she usually isn't like this."
[1963-08-03T11:10:00] Beach | I saw Bruno still speaking in his patient tone. I heard, "I'll go with her to buy a coconut."
[1963-08-03T11:15:00] Beach | I saw our eyes following him as he walked steadily across the sand. He moved with ease, as if the scorching heat beneath his feet didn't even exist. I saw that he was small in stature but solid, with a broad chest and strong thighs.
[1963-08-03T11:20:00] Beach | "I saw Lina say as Bruno and Pinochia walked towards the beach." I heard, "Let's go swimming."
[1963-08-03T11:30:00] Beach | I saw the three of us walking toward the sea, I was in the middle, and the two of them were on either side.
[1963-08-03T11:35:00] Beach | I saw Nino say to me, "See you at seven tomorrow morning." I found it hard to describe my feelings at that moment, a sudden sense of victory.
[1963-08-03T11:35:05] Beach | I thought, of course, I felt sorry for Pinocchio's fickle mood, but that sorrow was very slight and hardly affected my cheerful mood.
[1963-08-03T11:35:10] Beach | I thought about how I finally felt satisfied with myself, and a long, exciting weekend was waiting for me; at that moment, I felt proud to be there, with the most important person in my life, someone who even my parents and my brothers and sisters couldn't compare to.
[1963-08-03T11:40:00] Beach | I saw myself holding both of their hands and letting out a happy cry, pulling them into the cold, crashing sea water.
[1963-08-03T11:41:00] Beach | I saw us, as if we were one person, plunge into the sea.
locations: On the way to the beach

text:
[1963-08-03T11:42:00] Sea | I saw that once we entered the water, we let go of each other's hands. I thought about how I've never liked the cold seawater wetting my hair, and the feeling of seawater on my scalp and in my ears.
[1963-08-03T11:43:00] Sea | I saw myself immediately breaking the surface, shaking off the water.
[1963-08-03T11:45:00] Sea | I saw them start swimming, so I began to swim too in order to keep up. I immediately realized it was a very difficult thing to do.
[1963-08-03T11:46:00] Sea | I realized I couldn't swim straight ahead. My head was underwater, and I could calmly move my arms, but my right arm was stronger than my left, so I kept drifting off course. I was also worried about swallowing water.
[1963-08-03T11:50:00] Sea | I thought about how I tried to keep up with them. I'm nearsighted, but I still hoped I'd always be able to see them. I thought they would stop.
[1963-08-03T11:55:00] Sea | I saw my heart beating fast, then I slowed down until it finally stopped, floating on the water, watching them confidently swim one after another toward the distance.
[1963-08-03T12:00:00] Sea | I saw that, perhaps, they had swum too far. I had done the same—I had swum beyond the usual safe line, just on a whim. Normally, from that line, I could swim back to shore with just two strokes.
[1963-08-03T12:05:00] Sea | I saw that Lina had never crossed that line either, but now she was competing with Nino. I knew that although she had little experience, she never gave in, and she swam farther and farther away with him.
[1963-08-03T12:10:00] Sea | I thought about how worried I would be if she lost her strength, if she felt unwell. Nino is a good swimmer; he would help Lina, but what if he cramps up? What if he couldn't hold on either?
[1963-08-03T12:15:00] Sea | I looked around, the waves pushed me to the left, I couldn't wait for them here, I should go back to the shore.
[1963-08-03T12:15:05] Sea | I looked down. The sky-blue had turned into a deep blue, and the color below grew darker and darker, like night, even though the sun was shining on the sea, which shimmered with glints of white, as if connecting to the horizon. I thought that had been a mistake.
[1963-08-03T12:15:10] Sea | I thought I felt a deep chasm beneath my feet, without any solid ground, like a death trap that could spring open at any moment, piercing me, catching me, tearing me apart, dragging me down into the depths of the sea.
[1963-08-03T12:20:00] Sea | I forced myself to calm down and shouted, "Lina!" I saw, but I wasn't wearing my glasses, so I couldn't see anything. All I could see was a vast expanse of white sea.
[1963-08-03T12:25:00] Sea | I thought about my outing with Nino the next day as I slowly swam back, floating on my back, moving my arms and legs, and finally reaching the shore.
[1963-08-03T12:30:00] Beach | I saw myself sitting in the shallow water, straining to look at their dark heads far out on the sea, like two buoys, and I felt a sense of relief.
[1963-08-03T12:35:00] Beach | I saw that Lina was not only fine, but she had also caught up with Nino, swimming just as fast as him. I thought about how enthusiastic, exaggerated, and brave she was.
[1963-08-03T12:40:00] Beach | I saw myself stand up and walk over to Bruno, who was sitting next to us. "I heard 'Where's Pinocchio?' I asked."
[1963-08-03T12:40:05] Beach | I saw him smile shyly. I heard, "She's gone." I thought that he was trying to hide his sadness.
[1963-08-03T12:40:10] Beach | I heard, "Where did she go?"
"She went home. She said she wanted to pack her things."
"Things?"
"She wants to leave here. She can't stay away from her husband for so long."
[1963-08-03T12:50:00] Beach | I saw myself taking my things, and I made him watch Nino, especially watching Lina. I ran back, all wet, to see what was wrong with Pinocchio.
[1963-08-03T14:00:00] Renting House | I knew it was a terrible afternoon, and the situation got worse by nightfall. I saw Pinocchio really packing her suitcase, and Nunzia couldn't calm her down.
[1963-08-03T14:10:00] Rentals | "I don't want you to worry," Nunzia calmly reassured her, "Rino can wash his own underwear, he can cook, and his father is at home, plus there are other friends. He won't think you're here just for your own pleasure. He understands you're here to rest, to have a beautiful, healthy baby."
[1963-08-03T14:15:00] Rentals | "I heard, 'Come on! Let me help you put things away. I've never taken a vacation before, but thank God, we have money now. But we can't waste it. It's not a sin to enjoy ourselves, and your financial situation allows it. Pinocchio, my dear daughter!"
[1963-08-03T14:20:00] Renting house | I heard, "Rino has been working for a whole week, he's very tired now, and he's coming right away. Don't let him see you like this. You know him, he gets worried easily, and when he gets worried, he gets angry. And what happens when he gets angry?"
[1963-08-03T14:25:00] Rentals | I heard, "You want to go back to him, he's already left, he'll be with you soon, now you've met, you should be happy together. Now you look like this, it will make everyone unhappy. Do you think that's good?"
[1963-08-03T14:30:00] Renting House | I saw Nunzia pleading with all her might, but Pinocchia wouldn't listen at all.
[1963-08-03T14:40:00] Rentals | I joined the effort to persuade her, and finally we took the things out of her suitcase, only for her to put them back in again and start shouting. When she calmed down, we began all over again.
[1963-08-03T15:00:00] Rentals | I saw Lina come back later. She leaned against the door frame, frowning as she looked at us. A long wrinkle appeared on her forehead, and she just stood there, watching Pinocchio's confused state.
[1963-08-03T15:05:00] Renting House | I saw her nod, but she said nothing. I heard "Are you okay?" I asked.  
"You're swimming really well now."
[1963-08-03T15:10:00] Rentals | I know that once again her sister-in-law was insisting on leaving, saying goodbye to this place, and regretting all the things she hadn't done, sighing for her husband Rino. She contradictory said she couldn't bear to leave the sea, the scent of the garden, and the beach. I thought about the expression on her face, which looked both happy and sad. It was clear that Pinocchio's stubborn mischief had finally become more than she could stand.
[1963-08-03T15:15:00] Renting house | I saw that although Lina said nothing, she didn't utter her usual cruel and mocking words. Finally, she coldly muttered a sentence. I heard, "They're coming soon." I thought it wasn't about asking everyone to return to normal emotions, but more like announcing something urgent that threatened everyone.
[1963-08-03T15:20:00] Renting House | At that moment, Pinocchia completely broke down. She threw herself onto the suitcase that had already been closed.
[1963-08-03T15:30:00] Renting House | I saw Lina make a face, then went back to get herself ready. She didn't take long and came back, tying her dark hair up. I saw her wearing a very tight red dress.
[1963-08-03T16:00:00] Renting House | I saw her be the first to hear the sound of the "Lametta" motorcycle, stick her head out the window, and greet someone with enthusiasm, then speak to Pinocchia in a tone full of disdain, very seriously. I heard, "You'd better go wash your face and change out of that wet swimsuit."
[1963-08-03T16:05:00] Renting House | I saw Pinocchio looking at her, but she showed no reaction. I thought of how the two girls quickly exchanged something between them, a secret projection of their emotions, tiny molecules emitted from the depths of their hearts that left them broken and wounded. It was the trembling within that long second.
[1963-08-03T16:05:05] Apartment for Rent | I saw that I had captured it, I didn't understand exactly what it was, but they did, they understood each other, they shared an unspoken understanding. I thought that Pinocchio knew that Lina understood her situation, and she realized that Lina wanted to help her, even if it was with disdain. So she did what Lina told her to.

[1963-08-03T16:30:00] Rentals | I saw Stefano and Rino burst in immediately.
[1963-08-03T16:35:00] Renting house | I saw Lina being even more affectionate than the previous week; she embraced Stefano, and he embraced her.
[1963-08-03T16:40:00] Rentals | I saw Stefano take a small box out of his pocket. When she opened it and saw a gold chain with a heart-shaped pendant, she let out a joyful cry.
[1963-08-03T16:50:00] Rentals | I saw, of course, that Rino had also brought a small gift for Pinocchio, and Pinocchio did his best to act as excited as Lina. I thought of her, but she still couldn't hide her pain and vulnerability.
[1963-08-03T16:55:00] Renting House | I saw Rino's affectionate gestures, his embraces, and the gifts, which made her hastily conceal her true feelings, restoring her to the image of a happy wife. I thought of it, but only for a short time.
[1963-08-03T17:00:00] Renting House | I saw her lips begin to tremble, her tears like a fountain, and she spoke in a choked voice. I heard, "I've already packed my luggage. I don't want to stay here for another minute. I just want to be with you."
[1963-08-03T17:05:00] Renting House | I saw Rino smile, and this intense love moved him deeply. I heard him say, "I just want to be with you."
[1963-08-03T17:05:05] Renting House | I thought that in the end, he understood that his wife wasn't just saying how much she missed him—she was saying she really wanted to leave, and she had already made up her mind. She expressed her decision to go through that unbearable crying.
[1963-08-03T17:10:00] Rentals | I saw them close the door and start discussing, but their discussion was brief.
[1963-08-03T17:15:00] Renting House | I saw Rino come back to us, shouting at his mother. "I heard, 'Mom, I want to know what happened.'"
[1963-08-03T17:15:05] Rentals | I saw that his mother hadn't answered yet, and he glared fiercely at his sister. I heard, "If it's your fault, if it's really your fault, I'll break your face..."
[1963-08-03T17:15:10] Rentals | I saw and then he shouted something toward his wife's direction. "I heard, 'Enough! I've had enough, I'm fed up, get out here, I'm tired, I want to eat."
[1963-08-03T17:20:00] Rentals | I saw Pinocchia coming out with puffy eyes. After seeing her, Stefano made a joke to ease the mood, hugging his sister and sighing as he said. I heard, "Ah, my dear little sister, you women really drive us crazy."
[1963-08-03T17:25:00] Renting House | I saw that, and it seemed he suddenly remembered his previous outburst. He kissed Lina's lips. I thought about seeing another couple so unhappy, and he felt very happy, because the two of them were now unexpectedly cheerful.
[1963-08-03T18:00:00] Renting house | I saw everyone sitting at the table, and Nunzia silently served us rice.
[1963-08-03T18:10:00] Renting House | I saw it this time, but Rino couldn't take it anymore. He shouted that he wasn't hungry, and he threw the full plate of clam noodles into the middle of the kitchen.
[1963-08-03T18:15:00] Renting House | I saw something that made me feel very scared, and Pinocchio started to cry.
[1963-08-03T18:20:00] Renting House | I saw Stefano's tone also changed, becoming very impatient, and he said to his wife. I heard, "Let's go, I'll take you to a restaurant."
[1963-08-03T18:25:00] Rentals | I saw them leave the kitchen amid Nunzia and Pinocchia's protests. After a moment of silence, we heard the sound of the "Lametta" motorcycle starting up.
[1963-08-03T19:00:00] Renting House | I saw myself helping Nunzia clean the floor, then Rino stood up and went back to his room.
[1963-08-03T19:10:00] Rentals | I saw Pinocchia lock herself in the bathroom, but a little while later, she went back to the room and found her husband, then closed the door behind her.
[1963-08-03T19:20:00] Rentals | At that moment, Nunzia started muttering, as if she had forgotten that she was a very gentle and good-tempered mother-in-law. I heard, "Did you see that rotten woman making Rino suffer so much! What's wrong with her?"
[1963-08-03T19:25:00] Renting House | I told her I didn't know, and in fact I really didn't. All evening I was comforting her, rationalizing Pinocchio's feelings.
[1963-08-03T19:30:00] Renting House | I heard myself say that if I were pregnant, I would also want to stay by my husband's side, feeling protected and safe, taking on the responsibility of being a mother, while he took on the responsibility of being a father.
[1963-08-03T19:35:00] Renting House | I heard myself say that if Lina had come here for [pregnancy status], it was obvious that the treatment was very effective, that the sea had done its work on her. Just look at the expression of happiness on her face when Stefano arrived.
[1963-08-03T19:40:00] Rentals | I heard that Pinocchio is very beloved, and she longs to be in love with Rino every minute of every day, otherwise her heart would feel uneasy and painful.
[1963-08-03T20:00:00] Renting House | I saw that I and Nunzia had already cleaned the kitchen, and all the pots and pans were spotless. She said to me. I heard, "Elena, you really know how to counsel people! You're sure to have a bright future." I saw that moment, and the atmosphere was very peaceful.
[1963-08-03T20:05:00] Renting House | I saw tears welling up in her eyes as she muttered, "Lina should have gone to school, that was her destiny." "I heard her say, 'But my husband didn't want her to go to school,' and then she continued, 'I couldn't do anything about it. At that time, we didn't have any money, otherwise she would have been like you. But then she got married, took another path, and there was no going back. We're all at the mercy of life..."
[1963-08-03T20:10:00] Rentals | I saw her wish me happiness. I heard her say, "You're looking for a boy like you, who has been to school." She asked me if I really liked Nino's son.
[1963-08-03T20:15:00] Rentals | I said I didn't see it, but I told her that the next day I was going to go hiking with Nino. She was very happy and made me some sandwiches with sausage and cheese.
[1963-08-03T20:20:00] Renting House | I saw myself wrapping the sandwiches in paper, putting them into a bag, along with the towel I used to go to the beach and other things.
[1963-08-03T20:25:00] Renting House | I saw her tell me to be careful when I left, and then we said goodnight to each other.
[1963-08-03T21:00:00] Rentals | I saw myself returning to my small room, closing the door and starting to read, but it was hard to concentrate. I thought to myself that going out early the next day would definitely be very pleasant, with fresh and fragrant air.
[1963-08-03T21:05:00] Renting House | I thought about how much I loved the sea, even the crying and quarrels of Pinocchia, and the reconciliation between Lina and Stefano, whose feelings grew stronger every week.
[1963-08-03T21:10:00] Renting House | I thought about how much I longed for Nino! I wished that every day he would be by my side, with my friends, how happy it would be, even though they didn't know each other, even though sometimes we couldn't hide some bad feelings deep within our hearts.
[1963-08-03T23:00:00] Renting House | I saw Stefano and Lina returning. I heard the door open and close, heard them speaking in hushed tones, and heard the sound of water running from the tap.
[1963-08-03T23:30:00] Renting House | I saw myself turn off the light, and finally, I fell asleep. I heard the rustling of reeds outside the window and the commotion in the chicken coop.
[1963-08-04T02:00:00] Rentals | I saw it, but I immediately woke up—someone was in my room! "I did it," Lina said in a low voice.
[1963-08-04T02:00:05] Rentals | I saw her sit on the edge of my bed, and I wanted to turn on the light. I heard, "Don't turn on the light." She said, "I'll stay for just a little while."

[1963-08-04T02:00:10] Renting House | I saw it, but I still turned on the light and sat up.
[1963-08-04T02:00:15] Apartment for Rent | I saw her right in front of me, wearing a faded pink nightgown, her skin sunburned dark, making her eyes appear even whiter.
[1963-08-04T02:00:20] Renting House | I heard, "Did you see how far I swam today?"  
"You did great, but you really worried me today."
[1963-08-04T02:00:25] Rentals | I saw her shake her head very proudly, then smile, and suddenly, she became very serious. I thought, as if to say she was already quite at ease in the sea.
[1963-08-04T02:00:30] Renting House | I saw her speak all that had happened in one breath, like a penitent, even trying to hide some things from herself that she could not bring herself to confess. I heard, "I have something to tell you."  
"What is it?"  
"Nino [intimate act] me," she said. "He [intimate act] me, but I kept my lips closed."
[1963-08-04T02:10:00] Renting House | I saw her telling me in great detail—she had swum for a long time, was completely exhausted, but she was happy to have proven how capable she was. She leaned on Nino to save some strength, floating on the water.
[1963-08-04T02:10:05] Renting House | I saw how Nino, taking advantage of her closeness, pressed his lips tightly against hers. She immediately closed her mouth, and he tried to use his tongue to open it, but he never succeeded.
[1963-08-04T02:10:10] Rentals | I saw her push Nino and say. I heard him say, "Are you crazy? I'm already married."  
Nino's answer was, "I fell in love with you earlier than your husband, even back when we competed in the class competition, I was already in love with you."
[1963-08-04T02:10:15] Rentals | I saw Lina tell him never to do that again, and then they swam toward the shore, she said. I heard, "He was so forceful, he hurt my lips, and they still hurt now."
[1963-08-04T02:10:20] Rentals | I saw her waiting for my reaction, but I controlled myself, not asking any questions or making any comments.
[1963-08-04T02:10:25] Renting House | I saw her advise me not to go climbing with him the next day unless Bruno also went.
[1963-08-04T02:10:30] Renting House | I told her coldly that if Nino had [intimate act] with me, I wouldn't have any problem, because I wasn't married and didn't have a boyfriend, I added. I heard her say, "The only regret is that I don't like him. If he were to [intimate act] me, my feelings would be like [intimate act] a dead mouse."
[1963-08-04T02:10:35] Rentals | I saw that, so I pretended I couldn't help but yawn. She looked at me, then went to sleep. I thought about how I felt that her gaze contained tenderness and admiration.
[1963-08-04T03:00:00] Rentals | I cried all the way from the moment she left the room until the next dawn.
