[1974-11-11 18:05:00] San Gregorio Armeno | I thought so. I felt full of determination; my task was to pull Elena out of that trap.
[1974-11-11 18:10:00] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw my mother warmly welcoming Pietro, and she gave my two daughters one gift after another, which made them very happy. I heard, "This is for Dede, this is for Elsa."
[1974-11-11 18:15:00] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw my father was very agitated. I waited for my two younger brothers to come, but I found they were not at home. I heard his voice was a bit hoarse and felt he had grown thinner, losing even more status at home.
[1974-11-11 18:20:00] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw my father say it in a very calm way. I heard, "They've been working all along."
[1974-11-11 18:20:10] Elena's Parents' House | I saw what I asked. I heard, "What are they doing?"
[1974-11-11 18:20:20] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw my mother insert a comment. I heard "suffering."
[1974-11-11 18:20:30] San Gregorio Armeno | I heard, "Where?"
[1974-11-11 18:20:40] San Gregorio Armeno | I heard, "Marcello arranged jobs for them."
[1974-11-11 18:21:00] San Gregorio Armeno | I thought about how the Solara brothers had placed Antonio and what happened to him later.
[1974-11-11 18:21:10] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw what I asked. I heard, "What are they doing?"
[1974-11-11 18:21:20] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw my mother angrily respond. I heard, "It's fine as long as they bring money back home. Elena, Elisa isn't like you—Elisa thinks about all of us."
[1974-11-11 18:21:30] San Gregorio Armeno | I pretended not to hear, I said. I heard, "I'm back today, did you tell her? Where is she?"
[1974-11-11 18:21:40] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw my father lower his head, and my mother said impatiently. I heard, "She's in her own house."
[1974-11-11 18:21:50] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw myself saying angrily. I heard, "She doesn't live here anymore?"
[1974-11-11 18:22:00] San Gregorio Armeno | I heard "It's not living."
[1974-11-11 18:22:10] San Gregorio Armeno | I heard, "Since when?"
[1974-11-11 18:22:20] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw my mother say coldly. I heard, "It's been almost two months, and she has a nice house with Marcello in the new Mergellina."
[1974-11-11 18:25:00] San Gregorio Armeno | I saw that they weren't just engaged, they were living together. I wanted to go straight to Elena's house, but my mom kept on talking. I heard, "What are you doing? Your sister is preparing a surprise for you, stay here and wait, we'll go together later."
[1974-11-11 18:30:00] Elena's Parents' House | I saw it but didn't listen to her. I called Elena, and she was happy to hear from me, also a bit embarrassed. I said. I heard, "Wait for me, I'll be right there."
[1974-11-11 18:35:00] Capodimonte | I saw that I had left Pietro and the two daughters at my parents' house, and I was walking toward my sister's home.
[1974-11-11 18:40:00] Capodimonte | I saw peeling walls, bumpy roads, and trash everywhere. The walls were covered with obituary notices. I had never seen so many obituaries before. I thought to myself that this Mergellina seemed even more dilapidated.
[1974-11-11 18:42:00] Capodimonte | I saw old Ugo Solara, the grandfather of Marcello and Michele, was dead. I saw many exaggerated words on the obituary, and the sorrowful face of the Virgin Mary; the names of the deceased had already begun to fade and blur. I knew, according to the date on the obituary, it wasn't something recent, but rather about two months ago.
[1974-11-11 18:45:00] Capodimonte | I saw that, even so, these obituaries still clung to the street, not falling off. I thought that, as if out of respect, the other dead had decided to disappear quietly from this world.
[1974-11-11 18:50:00] Capodimonte | I saw many obituaries at the door of Stefano's Capodimonte, and the shop was open. I thought the shop was like a wound in the wall, empty and dark inside. Karachi was at the very back of the store, wearing a white coat, and then he vanished like a ghost.
[1974-11-11 18:55:00] Capodimonte | I saw myself walking up towards the tracks, passing by the place we had previously called New Capodimonte. I saw that the roller door was down, and it was slightly misaligned on both sides. It didn't close properly, and it was also rusty. There were vulgarities and drawings all over it.
[1974-11-11 19:00:00] Capodimonte | I saw that part of Mergellina seemed completely abandoned, the white houses from before had turned gray, and in some places, the plaster on the walls had peeled off, revealing the bricks underneath.
[1974-11-11 19:05:00] Capodimonte | I saw that I had passed the house where Lina used to live. I saw those half-dead saplings along the road, only a few still remained. The gate's glass had a broken piece, taped up with adhesive tape.
[1974-11-11 19:15:00] Castel dell'Ovo | I saw that Elena's place was much higher up, in a neater and more elegant neighborhood.
[1974-11-11 19:20:00] Elisha Apartment Building | I saw the gatekeeper stick his head out. He was a thin-haired, balding man who stopped me and rudely asked who I was looking for.
[1974-11-11 19:20:10] Elisha Apartment Building | I didn't know how to say it, so I mumbled something. I heard the word "Soraya."
[1974-11-11 19:20:20] Elisha Apartment Building | I saw him and he immediately showed me respect, letting me pass.
[1974-11-11 19:22:00] Elisha Apartment Elevator | I didn't realize how out of touch I was until I saw someone get into the elevator. I thought about the things I could accept in Porto or Mergellina: women could have freedom over their own bodies, could live together without marrying. But in our Mergellina, I couldn't accept it, because it involved my sister's future, and I just couldn't calm down.
[1974-11-11 19:22:10] Elisha Apartment Elevator | I thought about Elena marrying a dangerous person like Marcello and starting a family. Would my mother be happy?
[1974-11-11 19:22:20] Elisha Apartment Elevator | I thought about how we got married at the city hall, without a religious ceremony, and how she was so angry at the time.
[1974-11-11 19:22:30] Elisha Apartment Elevator | I thought about how she considered Lina a prostitute because she was living with Enzo, and how she saw Pinocchia as a shameless woman because she became Stefano's mistress. But now she was accepting her own younger daughter sleeping with Marcello—a bad man—without being married?
[1974-11-11 19:23:00] At the entrance of Elisa's apartment | I thought that way when I reached Elena's doorstep. I thought my anger was justified, but my mind—my trained mind—was in chaos, and I didn't know what arguments I had to make.
[1974-11-11 19:23:10] At the entrance of Elisa's apartment | Would I stand in my mother's shoes? Just as she reacted when I made the decision to get married a few years ago? Am I going back, clinging to the ideas she has already given up on?
[1974-11-11 19:23:20] Elisha Apartment Entrance | I think, or I would say: "You can be with whoever you want, but not with Marcello." Would I really say that? But now, in Mergellina, in Porto, which girl could I tell to leave the man she loves, no matter who he is?
locations: At the entrance of Elisa's apartment

text:
[1974-11-11 19:25:00] Elena's Apartment Interior | When I saw Elena opening the door for me, I hugged her tightly, so hard that she laughed. I heard, "You're hurting me."
[1974-11-11 19:30:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw her tell me to sit in the living room. I saw a very luxurious living room, filled with patterned sofas and individual armchairs with golden backs.
[1974-11-11 19:35:00] Elena's Apartment Living Room | I saw her start talking nonstop, circling around the subject, saying I looked very healthy, that my earrings were beautiful, that my necklace was beautiful, that I was so elegant, and how much she wanted to meet Dede and Elsa right away. I thought I sensed she was a bit guilty.
[1974-11-11 19:40:00] Elisha's Apartment Living Room | I saw myself enthusiastically mentioning my two daughters, I took off the earrings, had her try them on in front of the mirror, and then gave the earrings to her. I saw her face brighten, and she smiled.
[1974-11-11 19:41:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw her say it in a low voice. I heard, "I was worried you were here to scold me, to say you're against me being with Marcello."
[1974-11-11 19:42:00] Elena's Apartment Living Room | I watched her for a while and then said. I heard, "Elena, I'm against it. I came all this way just to tell you, tell Mom, Dad, and our brothers, I strongly oppose you being with him."
[1974-11-11 19:43:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw her face change, her eyes filled with tears. I heard, "You hurt me, why are you opposing it?"
[1974-11-11 19:43:10] Elena's Apartment Living Room | I heard, "The Solara family is no good."
[1974-11-11 19:43:20] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I heard, "Marcello is different."
[1974-11-11 19:45:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw her start talking to me about Marcello. I know she said, everything started when I was pregnant with Elsa. My mother went to Mergellina to take care of me, and the burden of the family fell entirely on her shoulders.
[1974-11-11 19:46:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I once saw her buying things at the Solara supermarket, and Rino, Lina's brother, said she could leave the shopping list and he would bring the items home for her. I knew that when Rino was speaking, she saw Marcello waving at her from a distance, indicating that it was his idea. From that moment on, Marcello began to circle around her, constantly trying to impress her.
[1974-11-11 19:47:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I knew Elena was thinking: He's old, and I don't like him. But he kept appearing right in front of her, very polite, and not a single gesture or word hinted at the hateful things the Solara family had done.
[1974-11-11 19:48:00] Elena's Apartment Living Room | I know Marcello is truly a good man, and being with him gives me a sense of security. He's strong and very caring; he's simply towering. Not only that, ever since he started being nice to Elisa, her life has changed.
[1974-11-11 19:49:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw everyone, both inside and outside of Mergellina, start treating her like a queen. Everyone valued her, and that was a beautiful feeling, she told me. She still wasn't used to it by then. I heard her say, "Before, you were nothing, but now even the rats in the sewers know your name. Of course, you wrote a book, you're famous now, and you've gotten used to this life full of attention, but I've never experienced anything like it—I'm absolutely stunned."
[1974-11-11 19:50:00] Elena's Apartment Living Room | I saw her continue speaking. I heard myself say, "I found out that nothing ever required my concern—Marcello handled everything. Whatever idea I had, he would carry it out. That was really exciting. The longer it went on, the more I liked him. Finally, I agreed to Marcello. Now, if I don't see him or hear him speak for a day, I can't sleep all night, and I'll cry uncontrollably."
[1974-11-11 19:51:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I thought to myself that Elena was certain she was extremely lucky, incredibly lucky. I understood that I didn't have the courage to ruin her happiness, and besides, she hadn't given me any chance to object.
[1974-11-11 19:52:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I kept hearing her say that Marcello was capable, responsible, handsome, and perfect. I know she was careful with every word she said, either distinguishing him from the other members of the Solara family or carefully mentioning them. She said his mother was very warm, his father had a bad stomach and hardly went out anymore. She also mentioned his deceased grandfather, and even Michele—after her contact with Michele, she felt he was different from what people said, he was more human.
[1974-11-11 19:53:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw her saying it to me. "I heard him say, 'So you have to believe me. Since I was born, I've never felt this good, not even Mom, you know how she is, she supports me too. Dad, and Gianni and Peppe, they're all on my side. Not long ago, Gianni and Peppe were idle, but now Marcello has found them something to do, and they're making a lot of money.'"
[1974-11-11 19:54:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw what I said. I heard, "If that's the case, then you two should get married."
[1974-11-11 19:55:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | "I heard her say, 'We will get married, but not now. After this period, we'll get married. Marcello said he has some business issues to resolve, some complicated things, plus his grandfather's funeral. That poor old man, by then was completely confused, couldn't walk or speak anymore. Thank God, He set him free."
[1974-11-11 19:56:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I heard, "But once these things are sorted out, we'll get married, don't worry. Plus, before getting married, we'd better try it out, see if the two of us are compatible, right?"
[1974-11-11 19:57:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw and then she said some more things, none of which were her own words, but rather phrases that those young, fashionable girls had read in the newspaper. I thought about comparing what she said with what I might have said on these topics, and I felt the difference probably wasn't very big—Elena's words would just be rougher.
[1974-11-11 19:58:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | What could I possibly argue? Before I came, I didn't know how to speak, and now I still don't know how to speak. I should have said, "There's nothing to expect, Elena. Everything is clear. Marcello will consume you, get used to your body, and then abandon you."
[1974-11-11 19:58:10] Elena's Apartment Living Room | I thought of saying those words, but they sounded too outdated; even my mother wouldn't dare say them to her now, so I gave up.
[1974-11-11 19:59:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I thought about how I had left, how I had freed myself from this place, but Elena was still here. If I had stayed, what would I have become? What choices would I have made? As a child, hadn't I also liked the Solara brothers?
[1974-11-11 19:59:10] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I thought, besides this, what benefit would I gain by leaving? I couldn't even find wise words to persuade my sister not to destroy herself.
[1974-11-11 20:00:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I look at Elena's face, which is beautiful and delicate, her figure is also well-proportioned, and her voice is soft.
[1974-11-11 20:00:10] Elena's Apartment Living Room | I thought about what I remembered: Marcello was tall and handsome, with a square face, healthy skin, and all over muscular. He was capable of maintaining a lasting and intense emotion for a woman: when he fell in love with Lina, he already showed this, and from that time on, there were no other affairs reported. What else can I say?
[1974-11-11 20:01:00] Elena's Apartment Living Room | I saw it all, and finally, she took a box and showed me the jewelry Marcello had given her. I thought that compared to those jewelry pieces, the earrings I had just given her were nothing at all.

[1974-11-11 20:02:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw her saying it to me. I heard, "Be careful yourself, don't get too carried away. Call me if you need anything."
[1974-11-11 20:03:00] Elisha's Apartment Living Room | I tried to stand up and leave, but she smiled and stopped me, saying. "I heard, 'Where are you going? Didn't your mother tell you? Everyone is coming here to eat, and I've prepared a lot of food.'"
[1974-11-11 20:03:10] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw myself asking, somewhat unwillingly. "I heard, 'Everyone? Who all?' "
[1974-11-11 20:03:20] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I heard, "Everyone, this is a surprise."
[1974-11-11 20:10:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw my parents come in first, then my two children and Pietro followed.
[1974-11-11 20:11:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw Elena giving Dede and Elsa many gifts, doting on them a lot. "I heard, 'Dede, sweetie, kiss me; Elsa, you're really strong, come to your auntie, do you know, our names are the same.'"
[1974-11-11 20:12:00] Elisha Apartment Living Room | I saw my mother disappear immediately into the kitchen, her head down, not looking at me.

[1974-11-12 11:25:00] Corridor: Capodimonte | I think about it now, and as I write this memory down, I realize that back then I didn't have enough material to figure out how Lina planned, how she acted, or how she dealt with the problems she encountered.

[1974-11-12 13:05:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought about all the things I missed after I left, and what kind of life I had imagined for myself.
[1974-11-12 13:10:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought about Lina, who had stayed behind. She now had a brand-new job, earned a lot of money, and enjoyed complete freedom to act according to her own plans. Although I didn't know what she was really thinking deep down.
[1974-11-12 13:15:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought about how she cared a lot for her son, having invested a lot in him from an early age, and she still did now. But it seemed she could free herself whenever she wanted. Her son wasn't as troublesome as my two daughters.

[1974-11-12 13:25:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought she said she never wanted to see Nino again, but I knew it wasn't true—she would see him again if the chance arose.
[1974-11-12 13:30:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought her life was turbulent, while mine was stagnant.
[1974-11-12 13:35:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I saw Pietro driving silently, while his two daughters argued, and I kept thinking about what might happen between her and Nino.

[1974-11-12 13:45:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought that after getting a lot of money, she would leave Michele, abandon Enzo, and finally decide to divorce Stefano. [1974-11-12 13:50:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought of becoming--a word that had obsessed me, the first time I had used it in this context.
[1974-11-12 13:55:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought about what I wanted to become—though I didn't know what I wanted to become, I had become—this much was certain, but there was no object following it. I had no real passion, no spontaneous ambition, and that was the problem.
[1974-11-12 14:00:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought about what I had been turned into, just because I was worried: Lila might become someone else and leave me behind.
[1974-11-12 14:05:00] Back to the car of Mergellina | I thought that my "becoming" was always along with her, but now I have to start over, becoming an independent person, freeing myself from her influence, and becoming myself.

[1974-11-12 18:32:00] Vomero | I saw Adele Airota's voice tremble slightly as she said. I heard, "You don't need to do anything, it's a good thing."
[1974-11-12 18:33:00] Vomero | I saw myself speaking hesitantly. "I was certainly happy, but what specific thing am I supposed to do? For example, am I supposed to go abroad to promote it?"
[1974-11-12 18:34:00] Vomero | I saw her gently answer me. I heard, "Elena, you don't need to do anything. Unfortunately, that book didn't sell anywhere."
[1974-11-13 10:00:00] Vomero | I called the publisher to ask about the progress of my book's translation and publication. I thought about how my mood had turned terrible, and what made me angry was that no one had thought to inform me of these things.

[1974-11-20 10:11:00] Vomero | I thought of useless paper, silent paper.
[1974-12-01 10:00:00] Vomero | I thought about how I had begun a weary, troubled time.

[1974-12-21 10:20:20] Vomero | I saw what I said. I heard, "He just wanted to scare you, he's a child."

[1976-04-27 20:00:00] Vomero | I had hesitated for hours, and finally I decided I should make an excuse not to have dinner with them, letting my husband take the two children by himself.
[1976-04-28 17:00:00] Vomero | I saw her, but the next day, I couldn't resist the temptation. I put on my clothes, took them off, put them back on again, and kept messing around with Pietro.
[1976-04-28 17:10:00] Vomero | I kept going to his room, sometimes wearing one dress, then another; sometimes with one hairstyle, then another, and seriously asking him. I heard, "What do you think I look like?"
[1976-04-28 17:10:10] Vomero | I saw him glance at me carelessly and say. I heard "Very good."
[1976-04-28 17:10:20] Vomero | I saw myself saying the answer. I heard, "How do I look in that blue dress?"
[1976-04-28 17:10:30] Vomero | I saw him nod. I thought about it, but I don't like that blue dress—it's too tight at the waist.
[1976-04-28 17:15:00] Vomero | I saw myself wearing the blue dress, returning to him, and saying to him. I heard, "It's too tight to wear."
[1976-04-28 17:15:10] Vomero | I saw Pietro speaking patiently. I heard, "Yes, the green one with flowers is better."
[1976-04-28 17:20:00] Vomero | I thought, in the end, Pietro couldn't give me any confidence because he ignored me. The more I thought about it, the worse I felt about myself—I had big breasts and a big butt, my hips were too wide, my hair was yellow and lifeless, and my nose was too big.
[1976-04-28 18:00:00] Vomero | I saw it, but in the end I went anyway. I wore a white blouse and a bright floral skirt, my only jewelry was the bracelet my mother had given me. I thought about how I had put my writings in my bag, and I told myself that I didn't care what she, him, or anyone else thought.

text:
[1976-04-28 20:00:00] Mask Loc 002 Restaurant | I realized I'd been dawdling all along, and in the end we were late. When we arrived at the restaurant, the Nino family was already seated at the table.
[1976-04-28 20:05:00] Mask Loc 002 Restaurant | I saw Nino introduce his wife, Elena.
[1976-04-28 20:06:00] Restaurant Mergellina | Her cheeks were beautiful, her jet-black hair was also beautiful, exactly like in the photo, but she wasn't as tall as me, and she didn't have a chest, although she was also rather plump. I thought my mood would change right away.
[1976-04-28 20:07:00] Restaurant Mergellina | I saw her wearing a bright red dress. She was especially happy, and as soon as she opened her mouth, her sharp voice and strong San Gregorio Armeno accent became obvious. I thought that the dress didn't suit her at all.
[1976-04-28 20:15:00] Restaurant Mergellina | I saw her start attacking Mergellina, the restaurant where we ate, the owner, anything Pietro had said, and my two daughters, naturally including me. I thought, especially throughout the whole evening, she had acted very naively.
[1976-04-28 20:30:00] Posillipo | I watched her constantly praising her husband—nobody was better than him, she agreed with everything he said, and would caress and embrace him, [intimate gestures] him. I wondered what this girl before me had in common with Lina, or even with Sylvia? They had nothing in common. Why then had Nino married her?
[1976-04-28 20:45:00] Posillipo | I watched him all night long. I thought about how he was very polite to his wife, letting her embrace him affectionately, and when she said those uneducated and foolish things, he would smile at her and casually play with their son. But his attitude toward my two daughters didn't change; he was very attentive to them.
[1976-04-28 21:00:00] Posillipo | I thought to myself that his wife would never have any effect on him. Elena was just a stepping stone in his turbulent life, but she wouldn't affect him at all. Nino would follow his own path, without caring about her.
[1976-04-28 21:10:00] Posillipo | I saw, especially when he recognized my bracelet, he grabbed my wrist for a few seconds, almost like he was touching me; he joked with my husband, asking if he had given me some time; especially, he asked how my writing was going. I found that, therefore, I felt increasingly at ease.
[1976-04-28 21:11:00] Posillipo | I saw what I said. I heard, "I've finished the first part."
[1976-04-28 21:12:00] Posillipo | I saw Nino asking Pietro seriously. I heard, "Did you see it?"
[1976-04-28 21:12:10] Posillipo | I heard, "Elena doesn't let me see anything."
[1976-04-28 21:12:20] Restaurant Mergellina | I saw myself retorting, but without any resentment, as if it were a game between us. I heard, "It's because you don't want to see it."
[1976-04-28 21:15:00] Posillipo | I saw Elena speak up at this moment; she didn't want to be left out of the conversation, so she asked. I heard, "What thing?"
[1976-04-28 21:15:10] Restaurant Mergellina | I saw her, but just as I was about to answer her, she suddenly thought of something else and eagerly asked me. I heard, "Can you go shopping with me tomorrow when Nino is working?"
[1976-04-28 21:16:00] Restaurant Mergellina | I saw myself pretending to be polite, smiling and saying, "Sure, that's fine."
[1976-04-28 21:30:00] Restaurant Door | I only had the chance to go up to Nino when we left the restaurant, and I whispered to him. I heard, "Do you want to take a look at what I've written?"
[1976-04-28 21:30:10] Restaurant Door | I saw him looking at me with genuine surprise. I heard, "You really want me to look?"
[1976-04-28 21:30:20] Restaurant Door | I said what I saw. I heard, "Yes, if you're not bored."
[1976-04-28 21:31:00] Restaurant Door | I saw myself hastily handing him the things I had written, my heart pounding like a drum. I thought as if I didn't want Pietro, Elena, and my two daughters to find out.
[1976-04-29 09:00:00] Vomero | I hadn't closed my eyes all night, but in the morning I forced myself to go meet Elena, as we had agreed to meet at the hotel entrance at ten o'clock.
[1976-04-29 09:05:00] Vomero | I was about to go out at nine o'clock when the phone rang. It was him.
[1976-04-29 09:06:00] Vomero | I saw him say it. I heard, "I'm sorry, I'm about to go into the library now. I won't have a chance to call you before tonight. Are you sure I didn't disturb you?"
[1976-04-29 09:06:10] Vomero | I heard, "Absolutely not."
[1976-04-29 09:06:20] Vomero | "I heard 'I read what you wrote.'"
[1976-04-29 09:06:30] Vomero | I heard, "Ah, so quickly?"
[1976-04-29 09:06:40] Vomero | "I heard, 'Yes, it's written so well. Your research skills are strong, your arguments are clear, and your creativity really impressed me. But what I'm most jealous of is your storytelling ability. You wrote something hard to categorize—I don't know if it's an essay or a novel. I think it's great.'"
[1976-04-29 09:06:50] Vomero | I heard, "Is that a weakness?"
[1976-04-29 09:07:00] Vomero | "I heard 'What?'"
[1976-04-29 09:07:10] Vomero | I heard, "The things I write can't be categorized."
[1976-04-29 09:07:20] Vomero | I heard, "Not at all, that's one of its advantages."
[1976-04-29 09:07:30] Vomero | I heard, "Do you think I should just publish it like that?"
[1976-04-29 09:07:40] Vomero | I heard, "It's absolutely necessary."
[1976-04-29 09:07:50] Vomero | I heard "Thank you."
[1976-04-29 09:08:00] Vomero | "I heard, 'Thank you. Now I have to go. Be patient with Elena, she seems domineering, but actually it's because of shyness. We'll return to San Gregorio Armeno tomorrow morning. After the election, I'll contact you. If you're willing, we can talk."
[1976-04-29 09:08:10] Vomero | I heard, "Of course I'd be happy to. Are you coming to stay at my house?"
[1976-04-29 09:08:20] Vomero | I heard, "Are you sure I won't disturb you?"
[1976-04-29 09:08:30] Vomero | I heard, "Absolutely not."
[1976-04-29 09:08:40] Vomero | "I heard 'Okay.'"
[1976-04-29 09:09:00] Vomero | I saw that he hadn't hung up, and I heard his breathing.
[1976-04-29 09:09:10] Vomero | I heard "Elena."
[1976-04-29 09:09:20] Vomero | I heard "Hmm."
[1976-04-29 09:09:30] Vomero | I heard, "About Lina, we were all wrong from the beginning."
[1976-04-29 09:09:40] Vomero | I heard, "Why do you say that?" I thought I felt very uncomfortable.
[1976-04-29 09:09:50] Vomero | I heard, "You've attributed your own special abilities to her."
[1976-04-29 09:10:00] Vomero | "I heard 'What about you?'"
[1976-04-29 09:10:10] Vomero | I heard, "I'm worse, I foolishly thought what I saw in you was what I saw in her."
[1976-04-29 09:10:30] Vomero | I thought for a few seconds, saying nothing. Why did he mention Lina? Why would he say such things over the phone?
[1976-04-29 09:10:40] Vomero | I thought he wanted to tell me that ever since childhood, he'd liked me, but on Ischia, he'd made a mistake, attributing the qualities that belonged to me to someone else.
[1976-04-29 09:11:00] Vomero | I saw what I said. I heard, "Hurry up and come."
[1976-04-29 12:00:00] Mercato | I saw myself with Elena and the three children shopping together. I felt very comfortable in my heart, and even if she were to stab me with a knife, I probably wouldn't feel any pain.
[1976-04-29 12:30:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw that Nino's wife, seeing how happy I was and how warm I was toward her, no longer had hostility toward me.
[1976-04-29 12:35:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw her praising Dede and Elsa, saying they were so well-behaved. She confessed to me that she admired me. I heard myself say, "I'm a little jealous of you, not because you're so capable, but because you've always known him, and I haven't."
[1976-04-29 12:40:00] Spaccanapoli | I heard her say, "I wish I had met him when he was a child, then I would have known what he looked like at ten, what he looked like at fourteen, what his voice was like before his voice changed, how he used to laugh as a child. Fortunately, I have Albert now, who looks exactly like his father."
[1976-04-29 12:45:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw myself looking at the child. I thought about it, but I didn't see Nino's shadow. Maybe he'll show up later.
[1976-04-29 12:46:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw Dede immediately say with great pride. I heard, "I am like my father."
[1976-04-29 12:47:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw Elsa continue. I heard, "I'm more like Mom."
[1976-04-29 12:50:00] Spaccanapoli | When I thought about it, I remembered Sylvia's son Mirko, who was really the same as Nino.
[1976-04-29 12:55:00] Spaccanapoli | I thought to myself that Nino surely couldn't have thought of Mirko; as far as I know, he had never shown any interest in Gennaro either.
[1976-04-29 13:00:00] Spaccanapoli
[1976-04-29 13:05:00] Spaccanapoli | I was thinking about these things when I told Elena that her son was exactly like his father when he was a boy. I felt happy about the lie I had told myself.
[1976-04-29 13:10:00] Spaccanapoli | I told her, in a warm and gentle tone, about Nino's appearance in elementary school, and then in high school, mentioned Teacher Galiani, and the time we spent on vacation together in Ischia with other friends.
[1976-04-29 14:00:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw that as we talked, she became increasingly friendly toward me and more and more trusting of me.
[1976-04-29 14:10:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw us enter a store. If I tried on a piece of clothing I liked but didn't buy, I would find that Elena had already bought it and given it to me when we left.
[1976-04-29 14:20:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw her wanting to buy clothes for Dede and Elsa, and when we ate in the restaurant, it was her who paid.

[1976-04-29 15:10:00] Vomero | I watched us say goodbye, and my two daughters and I kept waving until the car disappeared around the corner.
[1976-04-29 15:15:00] Vomero | I thought, she represented the other side of San Gregorio Armeno, but it was far from my own experience.
[1976-04-29 15:20:00] Vomero | I thought about how she spent money like water, as if the money had no value at all. Those certainly weren't Nino's earnings, and I ruled out that possibility.
[1976-04-29 15:30:00] Vomero | I thought about it, wondering what difference there was between the wealth of the bourgeoisie and the Solara family's wealth. How many secret transactions had those money gone through before becoming the lawyer's high salary and luxurious life.

[1976-05-01 10:10:00] Vomero | I called Mariarosa and, with a confident and cheerful tone, told her that I had put together the things we had discussed earlier. I thought to myself that I was sure I had written it well.

[1976-05-05 12:06:00] Vomero | I saw myself pretending to be natural as I asked him. I heard, "Aren't you going to eat something?"

[1976-05-05 13:00:00] Vomero | I made him something to eat while he was taking a shower, and then we had dinner together — me, him, and my two daughters. I know that at this moment, Pietro is giving exams to his students at the university.
[1976-05-05 14:00:00] Vomero | I didn't realize it until several hours later, when my mother-in-law called me, pretending to be angry. "I heard, 'Now you write things that Mariarosa reads, but you don't show them to me anymore. What's going on?'"

[1976-05-05 14:06:00] Vomero | I heard, "When you don't know what you've written, that means you've done it well. Anyway, you have to let me decide whether I'm interested or not."
[1976-05-05 14:10:00] Vomero | I saw that I had also sent her a copy, but I didn't take the matter to heart.
[1976-05-06 10:00:00] Vomero | I watched Nino for a full ten days. I thought about my state during this time, which was completely different from the one I had before, when I was passionately eager to attract men.
[1976-05-06 10:05:00] Vomero | I didn't joke around with him, nor did I speak to him in a sweet, coquettish way; I didn't show him any of that fawning and eager-to-please attitude; I didn't act like a liberated new woman, as my sister-in-law did; I didn't give him any hints; I didn't look at him with loving eyes; I didn't sit by him when he was sitting at the table, on the sofa, or in front of the TV.
[1976-05-06 10:10:00] Vomero | I didn't appear disheveled at home; I didn't create opportunities to be alone with him; I didn't brush my elbow against his elbow, my arm against his arm, my leg against his leg, or run into him head-on.

[1976-05-06 14:06:00] Vomero | I saw what I said. I heard, "Eve cannot exist on her own, and she doesn't know how to be independent. She exists outside of Adam, without support of her own. [1976-05-06 14:07:00] Vomero | I saw Nino's comment. I heard, "This is a very terrible situation."
[1976-05-06 14:08:00] Vomero | I saw myself glancing at him out of the corner of my eye, wondering if he was making fun of me. I thought about how very uneasy I was.
[1976-05-06 14:09:00] Vomero | I saw him mention several books I didn't know about, all related to the topic. He once again emphasized that the article could be published. I thought no, he wasn't joking, on the contrary, he had absolutely no sarcastic or joking intention at all.
[1976-05-06 14:10:00] Vomero | I saw him speaking these words, but he didn't look satisfied at all. In the end, I just said. I heard, "Mariarosa also really likes this article."
[1976-05-06 14:11:00] Vomero | At that moment, he asked about my sister-in-law, praising Mariarosa, both from the scholar's perspective and for how she took care of Franco Mari. After saying that, he went to the library.

[1976-05-09 15:30:00] Spaccanapoli | I saw Nino sitting next to Pietro, and I was sitting between my two daughters. I thought that when I realized he was laughing, I would laugh too, but I stopped laughing immediately.

[1976-05-12 16:10:00] Mercato | I saw that we had discussed many issues, and Nino kept talking to the two children. I saw that the weather was extremely hot, and there were many people in the city.
[1976-05-12 16:30:00] Mercato | I saw him constantly greeting people. Some addressed him with respect, and he introduced me to his friends, using a lot of praise. What surprised me was his fame, how many people knew him.
[1976-05-12 16:35:00] Mercato | I saw a very famous historian praising my two daughters. I thought, as if they were the children of me and Nino.

[1976-05-13 20:02:00] Vomero | I saw my husband flustered, his smile confused, but Nino emphasized his words, continuing to mock my husband for being too easily deceived by appearances.
[1976-05-14 08:00:00] Vomero | I saw that this situation was still continuing, and during breakfast the next day, another unpleasant incident occurred—Nino mentioned again the conflict between me and the religious teacher over the Holy Spirit. I thought about how I don't remember how it all began.

I thought about the way he spoke, like someone on TV spouting nonsense, yet he felt it necessary to explain the truth to his daughter.
[1976-05-14 08:15:00] Vomero | At that moment, I saw my husband deeply engrossed in talking to me and Nino about the afflicted apostles. He mentioned what the prophet Joel had said: "I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh," he said. I heard, "The Holy Spirit is an essential symbol that allows us to reflect on how different things relate to each other and find common ground."
[1976-05-14 08:20:00] Vomero | I saw Nino kept urging my husband to go on, and finally, he sighed. I heard, "I'll bet you're hiding a priest in your heart." I saw his expression becoming increasingly sarcastic.
[1976-05-14 08:21:00] Vomero | I saw him teasingly say to me. I heard, "Are you his wife or his Madonna?"
[1976-05-14 08:22:00] Vomero | I saw Pietro turn red, he looked a bit flustered, and finally he said. I heard, "I'm sorry I wasted your time, let's go to work." I thought about Pietro, who always liked to talk about religious issues, and I felt he was somewhat uncomfortable.
[1976-05-14 20:00:00] Vomero | I was seeing more and more moments like this, without any particularly obvious reason. I thought about how my relationship with Nino remained the same, very polite, courteous, and distant, but he had broken through the barrier with Pietro.

I thought of that kind of behavior which appears friendly on the surface but actually humiliates you, leaving you unable to resist without seeming petty.
[1976-05-14 20:10:00] Vomero | I thought that was the familiar tone, the one used by the smart people in our Mergellina toward the stupid ones, a kind of intimate gesture that made them submit, left them dialogueless, and turned them into the object of everyone's mockery.

[1976-05-14 20:20:00] Vomero | I saw him shaking his head, pretending to be joking. I thought sometimes he seemed to be asking: What did I do wrong? He hoped they could go back to how they were before, speaking to each other in that gentle and harmonious way.

[1976-05-14 20:40:00] Vomero | I thought to myself, I should take action, I should act immediately, but I did nothing. On the contrary, I found it hard to suppress my admiration for Nino, and the excitement within me — yes, it was excitement.

[1976-05-15 20:01:00] Vomero | I saw and then he asked Pietro. I heard, "Did you see it?"

[1976-10-06 22:10:00] Vomero | I thought Elena would understand that there's nothing you can do in the face of love; to someone who's leaving, saying "Don't go, stay!" is meaningless.
[1976-10-06 22:15:00] Vomero | I thought that, by all logic, Pietro understood this point, he just needed time, to digest it through his wisdom, and he would show a tolerant attitude.
[1976-10-06 22:20:00] Vomero | I thought to myself that things would be very hard for my two daughters.
[1976-10-07 10:00:00] Vomero | I opposed it, saying. I heard, "They're young, what would they know?"
[1976-10-07 10:05:00] Vomero | I saw him, but later he shouted at me. I heard her say, "If you decide to leave, you have to explain to your daughters why you're going. If you don't have the courage, then don't go. If you don't say anything, it means you're not sure about what you want to do."
[1976-10-07 10:06:00] Vomero | I heard myself mutter something. I heard, "We'll talk to the lawyer."
[1976-10-07 10:07:00] Vomero | I saw him say. I heard, "There's plenty of time to find a lawyer."
[1976-10-07 10:10:00] Vomero | I saw him suddenly shout for Dede and Elsa. I know that now, whenever they hear us shouting, they'll lock themselves in their room, all of them in complete agreement.
[1976-10-07 10:15:00] Vomero | I saw Pietro start to speak. "I heard, 'Your mother has something to say to you. Sit down and listen.'"
[1976-10-07 10:16:00] Vomero | I saw my two daughters sitting on the sofa, waiting for me to speak.
[1976-10-07 10:17:00] Vomero | I saw that I had already started speaking. I heard, "I was very much in love with your father, but now we have nothing in common, so we've decided to separate."
[1976-10-07 10:18:00] Vomero | I saw Pietro calmly interrupt me. I heard, "This isn't true. It was your mother who decided to leave me. Our love wasn't real—she doesn't want me anymore."
[1976-10-07 10:19:00] Vomero | I saw my emotions becoming agitated, and I said. "I heard, 'Children, it's not that simple. Even though they don't live together, two people can still love each other.'"
[1976-10-07 10:20:00] Vomero | I saw him interrupt me again. I heard, "This isn't real either. Either we love each other and live together, becoming a family; or we don't love each other, and then we part, and that's not a family anymore. If you lie, how can they understand? Please, be clear about the real reason we're breaking up."
[1976-10-07 10:21:00] Vomero | I saw what I said. I heard her say, "I'm not leaving you. You are the most important people to me. I can't live without you. It's just that I have a problem with your father."
[1976-10-07 10:22:00] Vomero | I saw him pressing me. I heard, "What's the problem? Say it clearly what the problem is."
[1976-10-07 10:23:00] Vomero | I saw myself sigh and say in a low voice. "I heard, 'I've fallen in love with someone else, and I've decided to live with him.'"
[1976-10-07 10:24:00] Vomero | I saw Elsa glancing at Dede, trying to figure out what reaction she should make. When she saw that Dede remained unmoved, she too acted as if she were unmoved.
[1976-10-07 10:25:00] Vomero | I saw it, but at that moment, my husband lost his patience and shouted. I heard, "Say his name, tell them what this man's name is. You don't want to say it? [1976-10-07 10:26:00] Vomero | I saw and then he cried out in despair. At that moment, Elsa asked quietly, full of concern. I heard, "Mom, will you take me with you?"
[1976-10-07 10:27:00] Vomero | I saw it, but before I could answer, she saw my sister stand up and leave, and she immediately followed her.
[1976-10-08 02:00:00] Vomero | That night, I saw Dede crying out in her dream, and I suddenly woke up, ran to check on her.
[1976-10-08 02:05:00] Vomero | I saw her asleep, but she had wet the bed. I had to wake her up, change her clothes, and change the sheets.
[1976-10-08 02:10:00] Vomero | I saw myself putting her on the bed, and she mumbled that she wanted to sleep in my bed. I agreed, and let her sleep next to me.
[1976-10-08 02:15:00] Vomero | I saw that in her dreams, she sometimes trembled, feeling around to make sure I was still by her side.

[1976-10-10 10:05:00] Vomero | I saw him say it. "I heard, 'Go! I'll never let you see the two children again.'"
[1976-10-10 10:06:00] Vomero | I saw and then said. "I heard, 'If you take the two children away, I'll [tragic event]."

[1976-10-10 10:35:00] Vomero | I thought about how he had chosen unscrupulous methods, even despicable ones, to continue being my husband.

[1976-10-10 20:17:00] Vomero | I saw his tone shift from pain to anger, he said in the end. I heard, "Do you understand what you've done to me? Do you understand the terrible situation you've put me in?"

[1976-10-10 20:25:00] Vomero | I thought about it, but I didn't go in that direction. I was certain that after so many years, Pietro finally mentioned his mother to me, deliberately making me think that way—just to hurt me and keep me.

[1976-10-15 10:20:00] Vomero | I thought to myself, I should hold on until that moment, and then speak.
[1976-10-15 10:25:00] Vomero | I thought, now I just long for this intense pain to ease up a little, I can't stand it anymore.
